required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Hydration Status When Consuming Alkaline Water Compared to Reverse Osmosis Purified Water.
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Hydration Status When Consuming Alkaline Water Compared to Reverse Osmosis Purified Water: A Randomized Controlled Cross-over Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: To conduct a randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled, cross-over trial in a population of chronically, moderately dehydrated people comparing two waters on hydration status.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized, double-blinded, placebo-controlled cross-over study design will be used to evaluate the effects of consumption of alkaline water against reverse osmosis water. The study is of 5 weeks' duration, with evaluation at baseline, 2 weeks (beginning of wash-out period), 3 weeks (end of wash-out period), and 5 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of hydration status using Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis
primary_outcome.description: Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis performed using an RJL system, capturing information on intracellular and extracellular water.

arm_group.description: Participants will consume 1.5 liters per day
Participants will consume 1.5 liters per day
